### Scrum

An Agile framework that focuses on cross-functional teamwork, accountability, and iteration. It's primarily used for software development, but its principles can be applied to other project management teams.

### Kanban

An Agile methodology that visualizes work on a Kanban board, which displays tasks as cards moving through different stages of the workflow.

### Feature Driven Development (FDD)

An older methodology that uses some agile principles, but is viewed as the predecessor of today's agile and lean methodologies. It focuses on frequently implementing client-valued features.

### Dynamic Systems Development Method (DSDM)

An Agile framework that focuses on delivering software on time and within budget. It emphasizes clear communication and requirements, collaboration, iteration, and user engagement.

### Adaptive Project Framework (APF)

A technique mainly used for IT projects where more traditional project management techniques don't apply.

### Lean Software Development

An iterative type of agile methodology that aims to optimize people, resources, effort, and energy of an organization.

### Rapid Application Development (RAD)

An iterative and incremental method that relies heavily on prototyping in order to obtain feedback from stakeholders.

### Test-Driven Development (TDD)

An Agile methodology that provides developers with a safety net of automated tests to ensure that any changes made to the code do not break existing functionality.

Description
Capital Technology Group (CTG) is on a mission to modernize and innovate the way the federal government delivers software. We are passionate about our work, dedicated to our clients, and committed to a culture of continuous learning and growth. For this role specifically, we are seeking individuals to help support high-impact, civic tech within the federal government.

As an integral part of the program, the DevOps Engineer will design and implement prototypes and/or proof-of-concepts for evaluating new or emerging technologies, analyze benefits and risks in implementing solutions using the new technologies, and provide development support with adoption of the new technologies within a project.

The DevOps Engineer will work closely with other teams to help us build functional systems that improve customer experience. Responsibilities include deploying product updates, identifying production issues, and implementing integrations that meet customer needs. If you have a solid background in software engineering and Docker/Kubernetes, Git, Jenkins, Terraform, AWS (or related cloud environments) - we'd love to chat with you.

Client Requirements: applicants MUST BE US Citizens and be able to obtain Public Trust clearance
